src: Yu    kɛ́r=an    yu  nó  gó  hospital?
trs: *Didn’t you take him to hospital? [pa07me 006]
Didn’t you take him to hospital?’ [pa07me 005]

src: Yu  de  kɛ́r=an    de  gó  hospital.
trs: You’re carrying him while going to the hospital.’ [pa07me 009]
I carried him to the dining-room.’ [ab03ab 091]

src: Kɛ́r    di  motó  yu  bríng  kán    fɔ  yá.
trs: Take the car and bring it here.’ [ro05de 036]

src: Dɛn  rɔ́n    na  farmacia,  receta    de  mɛ́rɛsin.
trs: They ran to the pharmacy, (to get a) prescription for medicine.’ [ab03ab 123]
After tomorrow, I will go see my mother.’ [ro05ee 131]
You came and removed it.’ [ro05ee 094]

src: Na  ín    e    \textstylePichiexamplebold{de}  \textstylePichiexamplebold{kán}    púl    mí    dán  torí.
trs: That’s when she was coming to tell me that story.’ [ab03ab 073]

src: Na  ín    e    kán  vɛ́ks,    e    kán  gó.
trs: That’s why he got angry, (and) he left.’ [fr03ft 190]

imt: if  \textsc{2sg}  want  cut.hair  \textsc{2sg}  want  go  \textsc{loc}  hairdresser’s  go  cut  \textsc{2sg}  hair
src: Ɛf  yu  wánt bába,  yu  wánt  \textstylePichiexamplebold{gó}  na  peluquería  \textstylePichiexamplebold{gó}  \textstylePichiexamplebold{kɔ́t}  yu  hía.
trs: If you want to have a hair-cut, you want to go cut your hair at the hairdresser’s.
I went to my home town in order to give birth.

src: Dɛn  kán  kɛ́r    mí    na  Madrid  fɔ  mék    dɛn  gó  opera  mí.
trs: They took me to Madrid in order to go and operate me.’ [fr03ft 026]

imt: \textsc{3sg.sbj}  \textsc{hab}  \textsc{be.loc}  like  \textsc{quot}    \textsc{3pl}  take  one  black  cloth  \textsc{3pl}  cover  \textsc{2sg.indp}
src: E    kin  dé    lɛk  sé    dɛn  ték  \textstylePichiexamplebold{wán}  \textstylePichiexamplebold{blák}    \textstylePichiexamplebold{lapá}   dɛn  kɔ́ba  yú.
trs: It is usually so that they cover you with a black cloth.’ [ed03sb 119]
I implored him in the name of God.’ [sa07fn 297]
You take the maize (and) you hold it.’ [dj03do 003]

src: \'{U}s=káyn  plɛ́nk  dɛn  ték    bíl    di  hós?
trs: What kind of board did they build the house with?’ [dj05ce 104]
How did you come here.’ [ro05ee 005]
The street was built with a caterpillar.’ [dj05be 078]
(With) what did they build the house with?’ [ye05ce 106]

src: \textstylePichiexamplebold{Wet}    ús=káyn  stík    yu  bin  \textstylePichiexamplebold{ték}    \textstylePichiexamplebold{bíl}   di  hós?
trs: (With) what kind of wood did you build the house with?’ [ro05de 050]

src: Yɛ́s,    Concha  fála    Princess    gó  viaje.
trs: Yes, Concha went on the voyage together with Princess.’ [dj05be 097]
I ate together with Boyé.’ [ur05fn 045]
Did he go with his mother?’ [fr03do 033]\is{comitative“ r}
Lage speaks Bube better than me.’ [fr03ab 012]\is{participant-introducing SVCs“ r}
I saw a white bird coming.’ [ed03sb 174]

src: If  yu  gó  fɔ  di  máred,  yu  \textstylePichiexamplebold{sí}=an    \textstylePichiexamplebold{e}    \textstylePichiexamplebold{fáyn}.
trs: If you go to the marriage, you see it (to be) nice.’ [\textit{Lit}. ‘(…) it is nice’] [hi03cb 006]

imt: \textsc{2sg}  just  hear    \textsc{quot}    person  \textsc{pl}  \textsc{pst}  \textsc{ipfv}  talk  but  \textsc{2sg}  \textsc{neg}  listen
src: Yu  jɔ́s  \textstylePichiexamplebold{hía}    \textstylePichiexamplebold{sé}    pɔ́sin  dɛn  bin  de  tɔ́k  bɔt  yu  nó  lístin.
trs: You just heard that people were talking but you didn’t listen.’ [au07se 109]
I was the last to eat/I ended up eating.’ [eb07fn 130]
*I ate last. [ra07ve 025]
I washed (myself) first.’ [ra07ve 023]
Did you come long ago?’ [ge07fn 164]

src: A    sté  wé  a    nɛ́va  chɔ́p.
trs: It’s been long since I haven’t eaten.’ [au07ec 081]
I carried him to the dining-room.’ [ab03ab 091]
*He came across me while (I was) cooking. [pa07me 017]

src: E    mít    mí    a    de  kúk    sɛ́f.
trs: He came across me while I was actually cooking.’ [ro05de 023]

src: Yu  pikín  sidɔ́n  de  chɔ́p  dɛn  tú  brɛ́d.
trs: Your child was sitting (there) eating those two loaves of bread.’ [ab03ab 128]
I left the door open.’ [pa07me 029]
He drank the water (and it was) cold.’ [ra07ve 004]
They ate the banana green [unripe].’ [dj05be 108]
I carried the bucket empty.’ [pa07me 039]
He left the room naked.’ [ra07ve 001]
He left work hungry.’ [ra07ve 073]

src: Yu  pikín  sidɔ́n  de  chɔ́p  dɛn  tú  brɛ́d.
trs: Your child was sitting there eating those two loaves of bread.’ [ab03ab 128]
The child is just (standing/sitting/lying) there crying.’ [pa07me 027]\is{posture verbs}

src: Dɛn  de  fála    dɛn  sɛ́f  dɛn  de  rɔ́n.
trs: They’re following each other running.’ [dj07re 005]
He painted the house black.’ [pa07me 037]
They prepared the coffee (it’s) too sweet.’ [ra07ve 064]
They built the road (and it’s) shoddy.’ [ra07ve 059]
They built it (and it’s) shoddy.’ \textsc{Or} ‘They built it shoddily.’ [ra07ve 060]
The woman cooked rice and sold it.’ \citep[72]{Finney2004}
I ate (until I was) tired (of it).’ (field data)
I’ve finished eating/ I’m done eating.’ (field data)
I travelled until (I was) tired (of it).’ [ju07ae 531]

src: Bɔt  wi  fít  de  plé,  a    \textstylePichiexamplebold{jám}        yú    yu  \textstylePichiexamplebold{fɔdɔ́n}.
trs: But we could be playing, I hit you (and) you fall.’ [au07se 178]\is{resultative constructions}
